contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Higashihiroshima |JapaneseName= 東広島市 |MapImage= Higashihiroshima in Hiroshima Prefecture.png |Region= [[Chūgoku region|Chūgoku]] ([[San'yō region|San'yō]]) |Prefecture= [[Hiroshima Prefecture|Hiroshima]] |District= |Area_km2= 635.32 |PopDate= June 30, 2011 |Population= 183,834 |Density_km2= 289.36 |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 34 |LatitudeMinutes= 25 |LatitudeSeconds= |LongtitudeDegrees= 132 |LongtitudeMinutes= 44 |LongtitudeSeconds= |Tree= [[Pine]] |Flower= [[Azalea]] |SymbolImage= |SymbolDescription= Flag |Mayor= [[Yoshio Kurata]] |CityHallPostalCode= 739-8601 |CityHallAddress=8-29 Saijō Sakaemachi, Higashihiroshima-shi, Hiroshima-ken |CityHallPhone= 082-422-2111 |CityHallLink= [http://www.city.higashihiroshima.hiroshima.jp/ Higashihiroshima City] }} {{nihongo|'''Higashihiroshima'''|東広島市|Higashihiroshima-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Hiroshima Prefecture]], Japan. Higashihiroshima is a [[university town]] of [[Hiroshima University]]. Higashihiroshima is adjacent to [[Hiroshima]], and so also forms a [[commuter town]] of Hiroshima. From old times, Higashihiroshima is famous for making [[sake]] and there are "white walls", "black and white check walls" and "red brick chimneys" along the "Sakagura-dori (sake brewery avenue)". An annual sake [[festival|matsuri]] is held every October. As of June 30, 2011 the city has an estimated [[population]] of 183,834 with 78,525 [[household]]s and a [[population density]] of 289.36 persons per km². The total area is 635.32 km². The city was founded on April 20, 1974 from the merger of the four towns of [[Saijō, Hiroshima (Kamo)|Saijō]], Hachihonmatsu, Shiwa, and Takaya in [[Kamo District, Hiroshima|Kamo District]]. In 1992, the population reached 100,000. On February 7, 2005, the towns of [[Kurose, Hiroshima|Kurose]], [[Kōchi, Hiroshima|Kōchi]], [[Toyosaka, Hiroshima|Toyosaka]], and [[Fukutomi, Hiroshima|Fukutomi]] in Kamo District, and the town of [[Akitsu, Hiroshima|Akitsu]] in [[Toyota District, Hiroshima|Toyota District]] were merged into Higashihiroshima. ==External links== * [http://www.city.higashihiroshima.hiroshima.jp/eng/ Higashihiroshima official website] {{en icon}} {{commonscat|Higashihiroshima, Hiroshima}} {{Hiroshima}} [[Category:Cities in Hiroshima Prefecture]]
